channel.title: W3C Web Platform Incubator Community Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Web Platform Incubator Community Group

item.title: [background-sync] Issue with "SyncManager.register()": incorrect params and return
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncManager/register

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

A lot of the information on the page appears to be incorrect. I see substantial discrepancies between the description of register() in the WICG spec and the MDN docs.

Specific section or headline?

There are discrepancies in all of the sections:

  • description
  • syntax
  • returns
  • parameters

What did you expect to see?

  • The description says that the method returns Promise<SyncRegistration>, but the spec says it's Promise<undefined>.
  • The syntax section shows that [options] are passed in as a parameter, but the spec says it's a single string used as the tag. The syntax also shows .then(function(syncRegistration) { ... }), but as previously stated, it's Promise<undefined>.
  • The returns section should be Promise<undefined>, not Promise<SyncRegistration>.
  • The parameters are incorrect. They don't mention the tag string value at all, and have a bunch of options that are... I'm not really sure where they come from, but I don't see them mentioned in the specification at all.

Did you test this? If so, how?

I am just comparing the MDN docs to the specification. I have used register('tagname') before, though, and I know that the parameter is supposed to be a string.

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/syncmanager/register
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncManager/register
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/syncmanager/register/index.html
  • Last commit: 7eaf51c
  • Document last modified: 2021-07-26T09:31:13.000Z

item.title: [html, web-locks] Avoiding duplication/confusion between Location+WorkerLocation and Navigator+WorkerNavigator
item.content:encoded:
mdn/browser-compat-data#9125 is a long discussion about the peculiar cases of Location+WorkerLocation and Navigator+WorkerNavigator, which are the only APIs on the web platform where distinct interfaces are used to represent the "same" thing in window and worker contexts.

For example, navigator.userAgent is available in both window and worker contexts, but navigator itself is a different kind of object. (This difference rarely matters in practice.)

BCD will follow the structure of specs/implementations, but on MDN there's duplication that might be possible to avoid. These pairs of pages and their subpages should be considered for merging or cross-linking:

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator + https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Location + https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerLocation

For location it's probably best to keep them separate since the worker variant is read-only. But navigator it's hard to see the usefulness of splits like this:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/languages
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator/languages
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/locks
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator/locks

item.title: [entries-api] Issue with "FileSystemFlags.exclusive": (short summary here please)
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemFlags/exclusive

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

define dirEntry is type of FileSystemDirectoryEntry;
the condition that is file: exist, when i use dirEntry .getFile(fileName.{create:true,exclusive :false}.function(fileEntry)=>{
console.log(fileEntry);
});
i find this condition it cant create new file to cover origin file in this page api introduction;

Specific section or headline?

What did you expect to see?

As the page saysï¼Œwhen i use params ,it will cover origin file

Did you test this? If so, how?

the dirEntry is type of FileSystemDirectoryEntry;
i use dirEntry .getFile(fileName.{create:true,exclusive :false}.function(fileEntry)=>{
console.log(fileEntry);
});
i find this condition it cant create new file to cover origin file in this page api introduction;

item.title: [speech-api] Issue with "SpeechSynthesisUtterance.rate": (demo is incomplete)
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechSynthesisUtterance/rate

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The html part of the demo is missing

What did you expect to see?

The full working demo

Did you test this? If so, how?

I recreated a working one here.
https://jsfiddle.net/chrisribe/2wt0qn5f/18/

I is based off of this github repo.
https://github.com/mdn/web-speech-api/tree/master/speak-easy-synthesis
